meanings.definition: Yites (noun): A group of people or things that are closely associated or related.
meanings.sent1: The yites gathered around the campfire for a storytelling session.
meanings.sent2: The family members formed a yites to celebrate the holiday together.
meanings.sent3: The yites of colorful birds in the garden chirped happily.
meanings.sent4: The yites of stars in the night sky twinkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The yites of books on the shelf seemed to whisper stories of their own.

meanings.definition: Yites (verb): To move quickly or suddenly in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The cat yites across the room to catch the toy mouse.
meanings.sent2: She yites out of bed when she hears the alarm clock.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel yites up the tree to escape the chasing dog.
meanings.sent4: The ball yites back and forth between the players in the game.
meanings.sent5: The leaves yites off the tree branches in the autumn breeze.

meanings.definition: Yites (adjective): Showing great enthusiasm or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The yites fans cheered loudly for their favorite team.
meanings.sent2: She had a yites reaction when she received the surprise gift.
meanings.sent3: The yites puppy wagged its tail eagerly for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The children's faces lit up with yites smiles at the sight of the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent5: The yites crowd danced joyfully at the music festival.
